trans-unit.source: Creating a virtual machine for a web project using Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Creating a virtual machine for a web project using Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Create a virtual machine for a website
trans-unit.target: Create a virtual machine for a website

trans-unit.source: Creating a virtual machine for a website with Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Creating a virtual machine for a website with Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: When you create a web project for an Azure website, you can provision a virtual machine in Azure.
trans-unit.target: When you create a web project for an Azure website, you can provision a virtual machine in Azure.

trans-unit.source: You can then configure the virtual machine with additional software, or use the virtual machine for diagnostic or debugging purposes.
trans-unit.target: You can then configure the virtual machine with additional software, or use the virtual machine for diagnostic or debugging purposes.

trans-unit.source: To create a virtual machine when you create a website, follow these steps:
trans-unit.target: To create a virtual machine when you create a website, follow these steps:

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, click **File** > **New** > **Project** > **Web**, and then choose **ASP.NET Web Application** (under the **Visual C#** or **Visual Basic** nodes).
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, click **File** > **New** > **Project** > **Web**, and then choose **ASP.NET Web Application** (under the **Visual C#** or **Visual Basic** nodes).

trans-unit.source: In the **New ASP.NET Project** dialog box, select the type of web application you want, and in the Azure section of the dialog box (in the lower-right corner), make sure that the **Host in the cloud** check box is selected (this check box is labeled **Create remote resources** in some installations).
trans-unit.target: In the **New ASP.NET Project** dialog box, select the type of web application you want, and in the Azure section of the dialog box (in the lower-right corner), make sure that the **Host in the cloud** check box is selected (this check box is labeled **Create remote resources** in some installations).

trans-unit.source: In the drop-down list under Microsoft Azure, choose **Virtual Machine**, and then click the **OK** button.
trans-unit.target: In the drop-down list under Microsoft Azure, choose **Virtual Machine**, and then click the **OK** button.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to Azure if you're prompted.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to Azure if you're prompted.

trans-unit.source: The **Create Virtual Machine** dialog box appears.
trans-unit.target: The **Create Virtual Machine** dialog box appears.

trans-unit.source: In the **DNS name** box, enter a name for the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: In the **DNS name** box, enter a name for the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: The DNS name must be unique in Azure.
trans-unit.target: The DNS name must be unique in Azure.

trans-unit.source: If the name you entered isn't available, a red exclamation point appears.
trans-unit.target: If the name you entered isn't available, a red exclamation point appears.

trans-unit.source: In the **Image** list, choose the image you want to base the virtual machine on.
trans-unit.target: In the **Image** list, choose the image you want to base the virtual machine on.

trans-unit.source: You can choose any of the standard Azure virtual machine images or your image that you've uploaded to Azure.
trans-unit.target: You can choose any of the standard Azure virtual machine images or your image that you've uploaded to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Leave the **Enable IIS and Web Deploy** check box selected unless you plan to install a different web server.
trans-unit.target: Leave the **Enable IIS and Web Deploy** check box selected unless you plan to install a different web server.

trans-unit.source: You won't be able to publish from Visual Studio if you disable Web Deploy.
trans-unit.target: You won't be able to publish from Visual Studio if you disable Web Deploy.

trans-unit.source: You can add IIS and Web Deploy to any of the packaged Windows Server images, including your own custom images.
trans-unit.target: You can add IIS and Web Deploy to any of the packaged Windows Server images, including your own custom images.

trans-unit.source: In the **Size** list, choose the size of the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: In the **Size** list, choose the size of the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Specify the sign-in credentials for this virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Specify the sign-in credentials for this virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Make a note of them, because you'll need them to access the machine through Remote Desktop.
trans-unit.target: Make a note of them, because you'll need them to access the machine through Remote Desktop.

trans-unit.source: In the **Location** list, choose the region to host the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: In the **Location** list, choose the region to host the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Click the **OK** button to start creating the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Click the **OK** button to start creating the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: You can follow the progress of the operation in the **Output** window.
trans-unit.target: You can follow the progress of the operation in the **Output** window.

trans-unit.source: When the virtual machine is provisioned, published scripts are created in a **PublishScripts** node in your solution.
trans-unit.target: When the virtual machine is provisioned, published scripts are created in a **PublishScripts** node in your solution.

trans-unit.source: The published script runs and provisions a virtual machine in Azure.
trans-unit.target: The published script runs and provisions a virtual machine in Azure.

trans-unit.source: The **Output** window shows the status.
trans-unit.target: The **Output** window shows the status.

trans-unit.source: The script performs the following actions to set up the virtual machine:
trans-unit.target: The script performs the following actions to set up the virtual machine:

trans-unit.source: Creates the virtual machine if it doesn't already exist.
trans-unit.target: Creates the virtual machine if it doesn't already exist.

trans-unit.source: Creates a storage account with a name that begins with `devtest`, but only if there isn't already such a storage account in the specified region.
trans-unit.target: Creates a storage account with a name that begins with `devtest`, but only if there isn't already such a storage account in the specified region.

trans-unit.source: Creates a cloud service as a container for the virtual machine, and creates a web role for the website.
trans-unit.target: Creates a cloud service as a container for the virtual machine, and creates a web role for the website.

trans-unit.source: Configures Web Deploy on the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Configures Web Deploy on the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Configures IIS and ASP.NET on the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Configures IIS and ASP.NET on the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) You can connect to the new virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) You can connect to the new virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: In **Server Explorer**, expand the **Virtual Machines** node, choose the node for the virtual machine you created, and on its shortcut menu, choose **Connect with Remote Desktop**.
trans-unit.target: In **Server Explorer**, expand the **Virtual Machines** node, choose the node for the virtual machine you created, and on its shortcut menu, choose **Connect with Remote Desktop**.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: If you want to customize the published scripts you created, read more in-depth information at [Using Windows PowerShell Scripts to Publish to Dev and Test Environments](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn642480.aspx).
trans-unit.target: If you want to customize the published scripts you created, read more in-depth information at [Using Windows PowerShell Scripts to Publish to Dev and Test Environments](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn642480.aspx).
